üõ∏

In the Omelnyk direction, Russian forces continued to advance following the fall of Hulyaipole and have made new progress in two different areas.
In the northeast, Russian forces continued advancing through the fields west of Hulyaipole, and entered the neighbouring town of Zaliznychne. They advanced along the two gulleys leading from the western edge of the city, establishing control over positions in the forest plantations there. 
Other forces advanced along the highway, capturing positions in two clusters of agricultural buildings and some treelines, before breaking into Zaliznychne. They quickly captured the railway station in the town centre, however, the 425th Separate Assault Regiment "Skala" launched a counterattack and managed to clear them out. Fighting continues in the eastern part of the town.
In the southwest, Russian forces restarted assault operations west of Luhivske. They advanced down the road to Bilohiriya and entrenched in the eastern houses of the village. Other forces crossed the Konka River from Novopokrovka and captured the southern part of Bilohirya, linking up with the first assault groups and continuing the clearing of the settlement.
+ ~4.95 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
+ ~0.29 km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

In the Dobropillya direction, Russian forces continued to advance west of Pokrovsk and have recaptured the Pokrovsk Coal Mine.
Building on their success southwest of the mine, Russian forces re-entered the western part of the mine from the nearby gulley. Other assault groups entered from the south, allowing for them to re-establish full control over it. 
Using the mine as an accumulation point, the Russians began pushing further north, capturing new positions in the forest plantations. Infiltrations were carried out to areas as far as 1.9 km north of the mine.
+ ~2.92 km¬≤ in favour of Russia. 
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

In the Kostyantynivka direction, Russian forces continued to advance and have made additional progress north of the Kleban-Bykske Reservoir.
Russian forces continued pushing west through the forests along the northern bank of the reservoir and captured new positions there as Ukrainian forces continued to withdraw. Other forces advanced from the north, capturing positions in the treelines and reaching the edge of the forests.
+ ~4.06 km¬≤ in favour of Russia. 
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

In the Lyman direction, Russian forces continued to advance in and around Dibrova.
After capturing the central and western part of Dibrova, Russian forces launched their final attacks on the main part of the village, establishing control over the remaining streets. Ukrainian forces retain control over a small residential area along the northern bank of the Sivserkyi Donets River. 
Other assault groups continued clearing the forests to the northwest and expanded their zone of control south of the earlier spearhead.
+ ~1.35 km¬≤ in favour of Russia. 
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

In the Kupyansk direction, Ukrainian forces continued their counterattacks and have made new progress on both banks of the Oskil River.
In the east, Ukrainian forces continued building on their previous successes and advanced further through the forests northwest of Petropavlivka, recapturing new positions there and establishing control over the small residential area that makes up part of the northwestern outskirts of the village. Additionally, they continued advancing northwest from Kucherivka, capturing new positions in the industrial zone and the adjacent forests. 
In the west, after extensive clearing operations, the last Russian soldiers surrendered in the "Comb" stronghold, which is made up of a number of high-rise buildings, allowing for the Ukrainians to establish full control over it and shift their efforts towards completing the capture of the city centre.
+ ~2.42 km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

In the Velykyi Burluk direction, Russian forces continued to slowly advance and have captured new positions in the direction of Kolodyazne.
After entering the small forest southeast of Dvorichanske, Russian forces captured the rest of it, entrenching along both sides of the gulley there. Other assault groups crossed the road northwest of Kamyanka and established control over another forest.
+ ~1.09 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.  
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

In the Bilyi Kolodyaz direction, Russian forces continued their assault operations and have made new progress in two different areas.
In the southwest, Russian forces managed to break through Ukrainian positions in the forests west of Lyman and reached the outskirts of Hrafske, consolidating in large parts of the forests. This allowed for them to finally entrench in around half of Prylipka after weeks of unsuccessful assaults, and capture positions in the forests to the south. Additionally, the Russians improved their positions in the forests southwest of Lyman in the direction of the Hrafske - Symynivka Road. 
Meanwhile, additional Ukrainian reinforcements were redeployed to this sector, who are now carrying out intensified counterattacks on Russian positions in southern Vilcha and southern Lyman. So far, the attacks on Vilcha have been unsuccessful and no confirmed advances have been made in Lyman. 
In the northeast, Russian forces continued incrementally advancing through Vovchanski-Khutory and captured most of the central part of the village. Fighting is ongoing for additional residential streets there.
+ ~4.60 km¬≤ in favour of Russia. 
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

In the Krasnopillya direction, over the last 10 days Russian forces continued to advance and have captured additional positions west of the international border.
In the south, Russian forces captured the last parts of the large forests and managed to capture the Ukrainian strongpoints along the railway line, which are situated at the highest elevation in all of Sumy Oblast. These positions were used by Ukrainian drone operators and contained repeaters for FPV drones used to attack border regions of Belgorod Oblast, including the town of Krasnaya Yaruga. Capturing this point was likely the primary objective of these Russian incursions (on the tactical level).
In the north, Russian forces advanced from the village of Vysoke into the nearby gulley and established control over positions in the forest plantations there. 
+ ~1.26 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

In the Khotin direction, Russian forces continued their intensified assault operations and have made new progress in the direction of Mala Korchakivka.
In the east, following an increase in their ability to supply Oleksiivka from the ground, Russian forces advanced south from the village down the C-191504 Road, capturing new positions in the treelines on either side of it. Other assault groups advanced from the treelines to the northwest, capturing additional positions further south down the road. From there, the Russians began pushing southeast down a treeline in the direction of forests north of Korchakivka.
In the west, under the cover of fog, Russian forces continued their assault operations in Andriivka and managed to dislodge the Ukrainians from their last positions in the southwestern houses of the village, thereby establishing full control over the settlement.
+ ~4.16 km¬≤ in favour of Russia. 
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

Last night, Russia carried out a large-scale Geran-2 attack on Zaporizhzhia City.
Approximately 16 drones were used, of which around 9 impacted targets in the city. Air defence shot down the remaining ~7. It appears that 2 of the drones impacted the Dnipro Hydroelectric Power Plant (47.86918, 35.08121).

Last night, Russia carried out a large-scale Geran-2 attack on Zaporizhzhia City.
Approximately 16 drones were used, of which around 9 impacted targets in the city. Air defence shot down the remaining ~7. It appears that 2 of the drones impacted the Dnipro Hydroelectric Power Plant (47.86918, 35.08121).

Overnight, Russia attacked the city of Slovyansk, Donetsk Oblast, with Geran-2 drones. 
At least five impacts were recorded within the city limits. Additionally, at least 3 drones impacted a target near Kramatorsk, closer to the frontline.

Overnight, Russia attacked the city of Slovyansk, Donetsk Oblast, with Geran-2 drones. 
At least five impacts were recorded within the city limits. Additionally, at least 3 drones impacted a target near Kramatorsk, closer to the frontline.
Unidentified missile to Kharkiv
Explosion in Kharkiv
Another missile. Possibly Tornado-S
Another explosion in Kharkiv

Ukrainian Neptune cruise missiles and possibly Storm Shadows were just launched at Belgorod City. 
At least one missile has been intercepted.
A Russian S-400 air defence missile was fired at the Ukrainian jets as they flew over Chuhuiv, Kharkiv Oblast.
Footage showing the moment of an interception over Belgorod.
It seems that one Storm Shadow cruise missile was intercepted, at an altitude of about 100 metres, over the city centre.

New Year's Exchange Of Fire: Russian Strikes Target Rail Hubs As Ukrainian Drone Hits Kherson Caf√©. Dozens Killed
On the night of January 1, 2026, according to data from the Ukrainian Air Force, Russian forces deployed 205 attack UAVs, of which 176 were shot down/suppressed. One of the key damaged objects was a UAV pilot training center in the Progress settlement of the Chernihiv region. The Russian side stated that precisely from this site, fixed-wing drones are launched at Russian territory, and that the strike destroyed between 10 and 15 crews.
At the other end of the country, in western Ukraine, Geran-2 attack UAVs struck the Lutsk oil depot. A column of smoke and fire data recorded by the FIRMS satellite service confirmed the successful hit.
Special attention was paid to transport logistics. Ukrainian Vice Prime Minister Dmytro Kuleba reported a massive attack on the country's key railway hubs, stretching from the Odesa region and Volyn to Sumy region. 
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

Military Situation In Gaza Strip On January 1, 2026 (Map Update)

Fighting Near Kupyansk in Ukraine: Attempts to Redeploy Ukrainian Reserves Do Not Change the Overall Picture
In the Kupyansk sector, the situation has stabilized with elements of a protracted positional struggle. Within this context, the Ukrainian command is attempting to redeploy additional forces and armored vehicles in preparation for new attempts to advance on the city.
In the Kharkiv sector, Russian units are advancing south of Vovchansk and have made progress in Vovchanski Khutora. They are also engaged in combat in the forested area between Prylypka and Liman, approaching Hrafske. In the same area, Ukrainian units repelled five counterattacks in the forest near Liman after spending two weeks reinforcing personnel for attacks.
In the Dobropillia salient, Russian¬†operations to clear Rodynske continue, as does fighting for Bilytske and Suvorove. In the Konstantynivka area, troops are advancing toward Stepanivka and have taken control of the northern part of the Kleban-Byk Reservoir. 
üëâ

HERE

‚ÄòLocked And Loaded‚Äô: Trump Threatens Iran Over Protests In Bid To Topple Regime
President Donald Trump said on January 2 that the United States is ‚Äúlocked and loaded and ready to go,‚Äù threatening that Washington would step in if Iran ‚Äúshoots and violently kills peaceful protesters."
‚ÄúIf Iran shoots and violently kills peaceful protesters, which is their custom, the United States of America will come to their rescue. We are locked and loaded and ready to go. Thank you for your attention to this matter!‚Äù Trump wrote on his Truth Social network.
Iran has been witnessing protests since December 28, when shopkeepers first took to the streets to condemn the government's handling of a sharp currency slide and rapidly rising prices.
The protests escalated into deadly clashes with security forces on January 1. According to the semi-official Fars news agency, three protesters were killed and 17 were injured during an attack on a police station in Iran's western province of Lorestan.
Read more 
HERE

China Loads Unique Truck-Mounted Electromagnetic Catapult Used To Launch Drones On Cargo Ship
China has apparently developed a truck-mounted electromagnetic aircraft launch system, or more simply a mobile electromagnetic catapult, for large drones.
The catapult, which is made up from at least three eight-wheeled trucks that look designed to lock together seamlessly in a chain, first came out from Hudong-Zhonghua shipyard on December 29. What appears to be a mockup of a Feihong FH-97 jet-powered stealth combat drone was loaded onto the catapult, and another appeared next to it.
The FH-97, first unveiled in 2021, was developed as a ‚Äúloyal wingman‚Äù drone, designed to suppress air defenses with electronic countermeasures, fly ahead of fighter jets to provide early warning, and absorb damage from attacks, as well as providing reconnaissance and damage evaluation. The drone can deploy not just precision-guided munitions, but also loitering munitions.
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE
